title: Here’s how to delete or deactivate your Twitter account
content:
Welcome to TNW Basics, a collection of tips, guides, and advice on how to easily get the most out of your gadgets, apps, and other stuff. Tired of Facebook too? We’ve got a guide for that. Oh, and Instagram? Yep, here’s how to delete that too.  Updated 4/25/22: So Elon Musk just bought Twitter for 44 billion dollars. Coincidentally, you’re also thinking now’s about the right time to get rid of your Twitter account. Maybe it’s best to just get away from it all and watch the imminent chaos from the sidelines. Or maybe you don’t care about Musk, but…

This story continues at The Next Web

Or just read more coverage about: Twitter
description: Elon Musk just bought Twitter. If you're thinking now's the time to leave, you have the option to deactivate your account for 30 days.
